channel.title: NPR Topics: Technology
channel.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 2 months in, how are Australia's age restrictions for social media working?
item.description: As more countries look to follow Australia's lead and introduce social media bans for children, we ask whether Australia's legislation is working.
item.content:encoded: As more countries look to follow Australia's lead and introduce social media bans for children, we ask whether Australia's legislation is working.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: Researchers say no evidence of TikTok censorship, but they remain wary
item.description: Posts have been going viral on social media accusing TikTok's new owners of suppressing content, but eight academics examined the issue and found no evidence to support the claims.
item.content:encoded:
Posts have been going viral on social media accusing TikTok's new owners of suppressing content, but eight academics examined the issue and found no evidence to support the claims.

(Image credit: Riccardo Milani)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Moltbook is the newest social media platform — but it's just for AI bots
item.description: A new message board for artificial intelligence agents has prompted some strange conversations, and existential questions about the inner lives of bots.
item.content:encoded:
A new message board for artificial intelligence agents has prompted some strange conversations, and existential questions about the inner lives of bots.

(Image credit: Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Trump grants tariff breaks to 'politically connected' companies, Senate Dems say
item.description: The White House's trade policy has "opened the door to corruption," according to a letter from Ron Wyden and Chris Van Hollen.
item.content:encoded:
The White House's trade policy has "opened the door to corruption," according to a letter from Ron Wyden and Chris Van Hollen.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: China bans hidden car door handles, a design popularized by Tesla
item.description: China has introduced new regulations, starting in 2027, requiring all car doors to open manually from both sides. Electric door handles can malfunction in a crash or battery failure.
item.content:encoded:
. Tesla's exterior door handles, which are electronically operated, can fail to operate in an emergency. China will ban exclusively electronic door handles on cars sold in the country starting next year.'/>

China has introduced new regulations, starting in 2027, requiring all car doors to open manually from both sides. Electric door handles can malfunction in a crash or battery failure.

(Image credit: Pedro Pardo)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Here's why people say they're using 'Are You Dead?' and apps like it
item.description: Safety check-in apps — a way for loved ones to know that you're alive — have become more popular among adults who feel that modern life has made connection and community more difficult to maintain.
item.content:encoded:
Safety check-in apps — a way for loved ones to know that you're alive — have become more popular among adults who feel that modern life has made connection and community more difficult to maintain.

(Image credit: Felice Rosa)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: The Trump administration exempts new nuclear reactors from environmental review
item.description: The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.
item.content:encoded:
The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Schools in China are making AI part of the curriculum
item.description: While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.
item.content:encoded: While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Kalshi in court over 19 federal lawsuits. What's the future of prediction markets?
item.description: Apps that let people wager on current events have experienced explosive growth in Trump's second term. But one of the leading markets is tied up in lawsuits that cloud the industry's future.
item.content:encoded:
Apps that let people wager on current events have experienced explosive growth in Trump's second term. But one of the leading markets is tied up in lawsuits that cloud the industry's future.

(Image credit: Olga Fedorova)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Tesla profits slumped 46% last year, as it lost its crown as the top EV seller
item.description: The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.
item.content:encoded:
The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske
